headline: Foolproof Chocolate Fudge
description: This classic and truly foolproof fudge recipe will be a favorite for years to come. Try one of our suggested variations or personalize the fudge by adding your favorite ingredients to the basic recipe. Fudge also makes a great homemade gift to share with family and friends.
name: Foolproof Chocolate Fudge
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can EAGLE BRAND® Sweetened Condensed Milk

recipeInstructions.text: In heavy saucepan, over low heat, melt chocolate chips with sweetened condensed milk and salt. Remove from heat; stir in nuts (optional) and vanilla.
Spread evenly into wax-paper-lined 8- or 9-inch square pan. Chill 2 hours or until firm.
Life fudge out of pan and place onto cutting board; peel off paper and cut into squares. Store covered in refrigerator.

review.reviewBody: Easy and quick. Good directions.
Make it every Christmas. Delicious, easy, can’t go wrong.

This was the first time that I ever made fudge and it was Amazing! I added 2 Tbls of butter like someone suggested and stirred it really well until nice and smooth. I added walnuts and took it to work and everyone absolutely Loved it! Thank you for this easy foolproof recipe. This will be my new tradition for years to come!

I had some pecans soaked in Kentucky Bourbon that I used in my fudge. Wow! It was fabulous and so much easier than making Bourbon balls. Think this is going to be a holiday tradition. I did add a little Bourbon to the chocolate. We don’t have any children around so it was okay.

I learned to make fudge using the semi sweet bars, sugar, milk, corn syrup... And beating it until t lost or maybe gained glossiness. This is just as good, simpler, and far more versatile. My adult children look forward to the many variations we have devised. Try drained and chopped maraschino cherries mixed in, or add instant coffee, almond extract, cherry extract, mix in pnut butter early for pnutbutter fudge.

Quick .. Easy ... and Delicious! I microwaved the chocolate chips and sweetened condensed milk together at 30 second intervals, stirring after each interval until it was all melted together. Stirred in vanilla, walnuts and a large handful of marshmallows. I lined my 8 inch pan with parchment paper .. (foil can be used as well) for easy removal.

when mixing and melting it came out kinda dry (not from over cooking chocolate ) so i added about a 1/4 cup of heavy cream and that brought it to a nice consistency i also used mint chocolate chips by hershey's.
Chocolate fix for sure. Easy

My family has been wanting fudge since I was unable to make it at Christmas. I looked up easy quick fudge and came across this recipe on my favorite recipe go to All Recipes.
It was easy , quick and I did a tweak to it. I used marshmallow fluff , both semi sweet and white chocolate chips. I added walnut halves to a third of the pan and put flakes of Himalayan salt lightly all over.
It came out savory and delicious. Definitely making it for gifts this Christmas!!
The stars are for the taste, but the fudge didn't set even overnight. Ended up making truffles out of them.

There are a few suggestions I would recommend. I would melt the chocolate before adding the milk. I would use all milk chocolate for a more fudgy flavor and line the pan with wax paper or parchment paper.

Easy, reliable, yum
Roll in anything yummy or add other flavorings

Using name brand ingredients (Ghirardelli & Eagle Brand) this recipe turned out to be easy, foolproof, rich and delicious. After cutting in bite sized pieces, i kept it in the freezer to extend its use. Out in the counter, it’s too tempting.

This is a quick fudge. It taste like a bag of semi sweet chocolate morsels. Just open a bag and eat them. It might taste completely different made from Milk Chocolate Chips but I will never know. I have always made scratch fudge and will continue to do so. Wish I could taste what others are tasting with this fudge but it can not be compare to scratch homemade fudge.

My mom's recipe from the 60's called this "Magic French Fudge" for unknown reasons. I have been making this for over forty years with a recipe from my 70's Nestle cookbook. Always a hit. I have to hide it if I make it ahead of time for an occasion or it will disappear like magic.
I would use different chips, like white chocolate or milk chocolate.
absolutely the best and easiest recipe ever! Great fudge!
I did it with white chocolate instead of regular and used 2 1/2 cups approximately. It tasted great and I would definitely use this recipe again!

Overall, this recipe was okay. A little too much "chocolate bar-ish" for me. I put peanuts in the batter, so that helped the blandness a bit. This was very quick, like 5 minutes quick, but overall not amazing fudge.
Quick - EASY - YUMMY

Delicious and absolutely full proof. This is also a great starter recipe for young cooks. You’re not “cooking” so much as warming slowly. My husband is the only family member who likes nuts in the fudge,so I do half with pecans (roast them for 15 minutes @ 325 with a pinch of salt for extra flavor ) and the kids like mini marshmallows. 
I’ve made this for so long,people just expect it. This fudge recipe along with Eagle Brand 7 layer bars are perfect small but sweet treats
This recipe is no fail! I added 1 cup of chopped walnuts and a cup of dried cranberries

This recipe shows 3 cups of chips and a 14 oz can of sweet condensed milk. I was making it and it was too thick. Other recipes show 2 cups of chips to one can of milk so I added 7 more oz of sweet condensed milk to this and it started to melt and look better.

This recipe shows 3 cups of chips and a 14 oz can of sweet condensed milk. I was making it and it was too thick. Other recipes show 2 cups of chips to one can of milk so I added 7 more oz of sweet condensed milk to this and it started to melt and look better.

I have been making this fudge for longer than I really care to admit! The variations are endless:
dark chocolate (60% or more) nuts, and espresso powder
white chocolate with orange zest, dried cranberries and nuts
melt peanut butter with your favorite chocolate
you are really only limited by your imagination. I've never had a batch fail. Use the best chocolate you can find, it truly will make a difference. 
Enjoy~
I have made this for years. Family loves it. Make it at Christmas to give to our neighbors. Delicious.......
It’s good and easy. You can swap chocolate easy enough. A bit creamy, not quite crumbly. Great starting point
My favorite fudge recipe. Always creamy. I do add more nuts though.
Used 1/2 chocolate chips and 1/2 Lindt milk chocolate. It was delicious! Might add some marshmallows to half next time. I like that it doesn't make a huge amount! Great easy recipe!

This is a wonderful recipe. I used half semi-sweet and half milk chocolate chips. It has a nice creamy texture. 
Will definitely make again!
Easy no fuss recipe that everyone loved!

I thought this was just meh. Instead of the vanilla I used a flavored liqueur which I've done before with a different recipe. Everyone else seemed to like this, so I give it a 4. I did it on the stove and at one point I thought the chocolate would seize up, it got kind of hard to stir at the end. I'll probably use this again since it was so easy and everyone else liked it.

The only change I made was I added two tablespoons of butter. I have made this many, many times over the past month. Everyone LOVES it! Even my picky older son. Who said "I ONLY like real fudge!" He kept eating it and was surprised at the texture and taste.
First time fudge ever turned out for me. Definitely a keeper.

Note the 2nd positive review: "I use one bag go milk chocolate chips and add 1/2 bag of semi-sweet also. This leaves a very nice creamy texture. Here's a little tip that everyone loves. Freeze the remaining 1/2 bag of semi-sweet chocolate chips. At the end of stirring, pour in the frozen chocolate chips, give the mix one good, quick, final stir, pour into pan and refrigerate. (I like it cold!) The mixture is hot enough to melt part, but not all, of the frozen chips. It will leave tiny chocolate chunks throughout. Want another tip? After preparing as I did above, add one cup of peanut butter to this recipe before the final stirring and refrigerate. Mmmm!! (If adding the frozen chocolate chips, always add them last to prevent them from melting totally.) Having trouble getting it out of the pan? Line the pan with foil. After it sets, simply lift it out, remove the foil, and place the fudge on a dish or cutting surface to cut."
I've made this recipe many times and everyone loves it. I add 3TBS of real butter as it is melting, that taste of butter in the fudge makes this recipe even better, a keeper.??
Very easy and delicious. Left out the salt and added lightly salted fresh pecans.
I added bourbon, came out great
I made it as written except I used Eagle Brand Chocolate flavored Sweetened condensed milk. This fudge is awesome!

So easy, so delicious! I have to hide them in my fridge to keep from devouring them all by myself! Added a bit more walnuts to make them crunchier. Plan to make another batch and package them as Christmas treats for my friend. Thanks for a real keeper!

i made the exact recipe. it is so easy. used the microwave version. when you use the wax paper in pan it lifts out fine. i would be careful if using the tip of dipping pan in warm water, it may change consistency. remember chill, not freeze. a good easy , fast fudge recipe.
Delicious! Simple to do and versatile. I added some peanuts and rice crispy for a crunch.

I made the Rocky Road variation of this fudge recipe, and it came out great! Lining the 9x13 baking dish with wax paper makes removal very easy. I will definitely be making a lot of this 
Rocky Road fudge around the holidays.

I took the suggestion to try different ingredients. I used a 14oz bag of coconut flakes, blended well with the morsels and Bakers semi sweet squares of chocolate, instead of walnuts. (Next time I may use them both :) Measurements are by eye, taste and consistency. As it cools and thickens, I'll spoon generous dollops onto a cookie sheet resting on a bed of ice cubes in the sink.

I don't know what I was thinking. I guess I was distracted when I was throwing together several desserts and used this recipe to make some fudge. Brought it to the party and only then realized that it was like dark chocolate fudge. Not gross, but not my cup of tea either. Most people at the party were looking for a milk chocolate fudge, but a few people thought it was really delicious. So not really a loss, but I would make the appropriate changes next time.

I love this fudge! It doesn't have quite the same flavor or texture as the classic 'never fail' cooked variety, but it still excellent (and a lot quicker!). I used 2c semi sweet and 1c milk chocolate morsels, and 2 tsp vanilla. I make a couple of batches a year and keep small portions in the freezer.

This fudge is so delicious and simple! Great for a quick sweet treat. I've made it twice in the last week, the first time-exactly as written. The second time I was short on semi-sweet chips, so used two cups semi and one cup milk chocolate chips. Be sure to use good quality chips, as the chocolate is the main focal point. With the second batch, I did not stir the nuts in, but after pouring the fudge in the pan, I sprinkled the top with chopped pecans and toffee chips, and pressed it in so it would stick, before placing fudge in fridge to set. I placed each square in a mini baking cup and stacked it on a pretty tray. Everyone loved it! No one knows how simple it was to make ;D

I did 1 cup dark chocolate chunks and 2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips and substituted peppermint extract for the vanilla (in equal measure). I used a double boiler and melted the ingredients until they were just barely all soft and mixed then took them off the heat immediately. My husband said this is the best fudge he's ever had - not too sweet, just the right consistency. This will be a Christmas staple!

I've made this as written and it's pretty good - a bit dark, but ok. I decided to make it today, using 1/2 semi-sweet and 1/2 milk chocolate, 1 t. Kahlua, and 1 t. vanilla - I also added a good sized pinch of instant coffee along with a cup of walnuts. Results is a type of mocha candy - not too sweet and has that little "something different" about it. Try it for a change!

I love the original recipe. It is easy and simple and delicious.

However, I tried the rocky road variation, and it was not good. Way too many marshmallows for the amount of chocolate used. I bet it will taste nice, but because the chocolate cannot adequately cover the marshmallows, it is ugly and doesn't spread nicely in the pan. I give that recipe 2 stars.
Easy and delicious. Tastes like the real thing.
Not fudge at all..this taste like cheap Easter bunny. Same texture too.
it is so sticky

I have used this recipe for years and it's never failed me. I don't add the vanilla or salt, though. I do add a bag of reese's peanut butter chips for peanut butter chocolate fudge (gently fold in the peanut butter chips). This is especially good if you don't like the typical sweet fudge. *I also line the pan with tin foil instead of wax paper, works great.
Instead of vanilla, my mom would use 1 1/2 tsp of rum. Delicious
I have tried many fudge recipes and this is, by far, my favorite. I follow the directions exactly and wait for it to gloss, it's really foolproof.

I used a mocha, salted caramel version. 2 c. semi-sweet chips melted with 1 c milk chocolate chips along with the can of sweetened cond. milk and 1 t vanilla, 1 t instant espresso powder dissolved in 2 T half and half. Melt stir till smooth and pour in 8" foil lined pan. Meanwhile, melt 1 c caramel bits with 1 T half and half. Pour over fudge in pan and swirl with a knife. Sprinkle with a bit of coarse sea salt. Just gilded the lily a little :)

I actually do this in the microwave in a glass bowl. I make two batches at a time. Heat for 3 mins. Take it out and stir. Heat for another 3 mins. Add nuts and vanilla. Stir again and done.I make this every year. Everyone looks forward to it every Christmas. To get the fudge out of the pan easily, line the pans with plastic wrap. After it cools you can just lift it out by the overlapping edges of the film.
Really good! Everyone loves it. I hope to put my own touch to it and make for all the holidays!
Quick and easy. It's the perfect recipe. I follow the recipe exactly.
Love this recipe thank you so much it turned out great !

Made this today for easy no bake dessert. Added chopped Reese's Peanut Butter Cups pressed on top before chilling.
Was ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!
it was a sweet treat but was nothing like real fudge in texture or taste ,I was a little disapointed in this so called fudge recipe.
Easy, quick, pretty tasty. Not perfect.
Yum yummy made xmas 2013.

This turned out great! This is exactly what I wanted my fudge to taste like. I have always been afraid to try and make fudge but you literally cannot mess this up! Going to try a peanut butter variation soon using peanut butter chips.
As good as ever! I've made this recipe a few times. I used marshmallows this time. Although this recipe won't get you a gourmet-style fudge, it's still an excellent beginner recipe.

It wasn't like real fudge- you can definitely tell it's a shortcut- like others, I thought it tasted like semi-sweet chips. It might be better if you use milk chocolate chips. I tried it with butterscotch and also white chocolate chips, but it never set up enough to cut into firm squares with those. We ate a few pieces and ended up throwing it out. Too bad, because I was going to give it as gifts.
easy peasy, and I thought I had to have marshmellows.

Just made these and loved them. I am a dark chocolate lover so I used Gharadelli Dark Chocolate Chips. I used chopped pecans and melted the chips and milk in a pyrex in the microwave, worked wonderfully. I sprinkled a few crushed peppermint pieces on top after spreading it into the dish for a lovely mint touch (good for Christmas). I also lined my dish with foil, leaving some hanging over the edge and sprayed it lightly with oil. It was a snap to lift from the dish, put on a cutting board and cut into any size piece desired!

This is the recipe for fudge my mom made and we've loved through the years. I add 1 cup milk chocolate chips and 1 T of corn syrup to make a smoother taste and texture. I like to make half a batch just with nuts and half a batch with rum-soaked raisins and nuts. 
Two tips: 
1. I line a glass container with aluminum foil will extra foil on the edges to help lift the fudge out.
2. When the fudge is lightly set I take a pizza cutter and cut my pieces then let it set fully. When I'm ready to serve it, it is already evenly scored and it comes apart neatly.
This is a wonderful, not too sweet, fudge to make with children, too.

Best fudge ever. I've done the 'fantasy fudge' on the back of the Marshmallow Creme recipe forever and ever. Never really loved the grainy texture, the sticky knuckles of trying to get the marshmallow out of the jar, stirring for long periods over a hot stove waiting for the right temperature, only to have it sometimes not set up or set way too hard.

Not this recipe. Super easy, prepares fast, sets up fast, no question as to whether it will set properly, and it is SO SMOOTH. Versatile too, as you can add any nuts, or even 1/2 a cup of PB for chocolate/pb fudge.
This recipe was so easy! I didn't change anything. I also tried the reduced fat versions the condensed milk and it still worked great!

This is simple, almost foolproof and it be altered into so many different tastes - just use your imagination. I almost always reduce the chips to two cups. Most of the time I use a mixture of 1/2 semi sweet and 1/2 milk chocolate chips. I vary the additions (extracts, spices, fruit nuts, cereals) whatever occurs to me at the time. I have used white chips with lemon, orange or maple extract. Pour it into a bigger pan and top with batch chocolate fudge. YUM! Yep, you are only limited by your imagination. Personally I think this so much better than the popular Fantasy Fudge made with marshmallow crème and cocoa.
Add 1/4 tsp of salt and 2 tbsp of butter, and this is to die for!!

Tate's yummy! So good. Only thing is that next time I will try milk chocolate Chips because semi-sweet is a little overpowering. Really is FoolProof. Very close to chocolate fudge you would buy. Love it. MUST TRY!
A family favourite around here. You can tell it's foolproof because even I can make it.
This was a holiday hit! I spayed the bottom of my pan with oil. Also,i added 7oz of marshmellow fluff.
I made this tonight. It was SO yummy. I doubled the recipe and made a large pan of it. Forgot all about the marshmellows. Dont forget the marshmellows!
super easy for the kids I love it when I am in a bind for a quick homemade gift
came out perfect, my husband loves it

The second time I made this recipe, I made two batches. I used a 9x13" pan. I used dark chocolate, ghirardelli 60% choc. chips for the first batch. I spread it on the bottom of the pan. Then, I made a batch with ghirardelli milk chocolate chips,and spread it on top of the dark. The two types of chocolate, layered like that, with the contrasting flavors of dark and milk chocolate in each bite is tantalizing to the taste buds! My family and neighbors love it! I do have some problems with the dark choc. mixture becoming grainy. Will try 16oz. instead of 18 next time. The milk choc has been perfect each time.
Suggestions on why this is happening are most welcome!
Sooo easy, and way too tasty to leave lying around. I divided the batch in two, and mixed half with chopped nut, and the other half with chopped up plain cookies (biscuits in England).
I make this each year for the people that I work with and they can not wait till they get it
I omitted the nuts in this. I used 1/2 white chocolate chips and half semi-sweet. The fudge was really good, but the semi-sweet chocolate clumped and turned solid.
I guess this recipe isn't completely foolproof...either that or I'm just an exceptional fool. This never set for me at all.

I have never made fudge before, and this was beyond simple. I used 2 tsp Vanilla, following the recipe on my can of condensed milk, but the recipe was otherwise exact. Next time I will try one cup milk chocolate as other's have suggested, just to try the difference, but I thought this recipe was great as is. Soft, shiny, perfect textured fudge that tastes like it took a lot longer to make. I will make again for my work's bake sale fundraiser this month.
it really does not have the sweet taste that I am looking for.

This recipe came out exactly right. I made a little change to this recipe by swapping out half of the semi-sweet chocolate chips with butterscotch chips. The outcome was delicious! It gave the fudge a lot more flavor. I also recommend swapping out half of the semi-sweet chocolate chips with peanut butter chips. These add a lot of flavor and are a different kind of fudge. I will definitely be making this fudge again.

I had a big bag of chocolate left over from Christmas that wasn't the nicest chocolate for eating. So I found this recipe and made fudge and everyone thought it was delicious ! What a find - I will use this again and again ! I also mixed dark, milk & white chocolate and added marshmallows. Perfect !
I didn't love this fudge- when it set in the fridge, it had white spots on it from all of the fat from the butter. Kinda gross.

It is simple to make and does taste good, but not excellent. I made the dark chocolate version that uses marshmallows and it was good, but not the best. I also tried a batch with Andes mints melted in...I don't recommend that because it surprisingly did not taste good. 
I may try to make this fudge again, but will just try the regular version without marshmallows.
not quite the same as the real thing but in a pinch it's pretty good and very easy!
It doesn't get any easier than this. Two minutes in the microwave, some stirring, and i put it in my toaster oven tray, lined with plastic wrap and sprayed with cooking spray and chilled.
pretty good fudge. my husband is giving it out at work, the rest is going to family on christmas.

This recipe was really easy to make. I followed the recipe to the letter. I made a double batch as I am giving this away for Christmas presents. I omitted the walnuts and crushed up some almond roca's to sprinkle on top before I put it into the fridge to cool.

Just make sure to keep heat on low and stir the whole time. Don't be tempted to do other things whilst the chocolate is melting.

This "fudge" was really just like eating softened chic chips. And really since that was pretty much the recipe, I'm not surprised. It was very easy, and if you just want a choc treat, it tasted fine, but it just wasn't fudge.
Love this recipe, but this year I tried something a little different- I used only two cups of chocolate chips and put in a cup of dried cranberries along with the chopped pecans. YUM!

This is an easy quick fudge recipe that will never turn out grainy. I have found that I get an overly thick mess if I use 3 cups chocolate chips, as another reviewer found. I use 2 or 2 1/2 cups of chips instead, and it works out much better. I also microwave the sweetened condenced milk in the microwave before adding the chips, then pour them in and stir until melted.
